column2: ISO/IEC/IEEE defines architecture as the fundamental concepts or properties of a system in its environment embodied in its elements, relationships, and in the principles of its design and evolution.
The ArchiMate modeling language was created in the period ______ by the Telematica Instituut.
Which of the following statement is correct regarding the Architecture Viewpoint?
column3: A) A representation of a system from the perspective of a related set of concerns
column4: B) A specification of the conventions for a particular kind of architecture view
column5: C) A collection of concepts in the context of the ArchiMate language structure
column6: D) A connection between a source and target concept. Classified as structural, dependency, dynamic, or other

column2: Which of the following statement best describes the Stakeholder?
column4: B) All members of the organisation
column5: C) People who have key roles in, or concerns about the system
column6: D) A stockholder who owns shares in the organisation

column2: How many layers of the ArchiMate core language?

In ArchiMate models, which of the following colour used for the Technology Layer?

Which of the following statement is correct regarding Structural Relationships?
column3: A) It describes that the element on the source side contains, groups, performs, or realises the concept on the target side of the relationship
column4: B) It represents that an element combines one or more other concepts
column5: C) It represents the ability of behaviour and active structure elements to observe or act upon passive structure elements
column6: D) It represents that an element affects the implementation or achievement of some motivation element

column2: Which of the following statement is correct regarding the Driver?
column3: A) It represents an external or internal condition that motivates an organisation to define its goals and implement the changes necessary to achieve them
column4: B) It may reveal strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, or threats for some area of interest
column5: C) It represents a high-level statement of intent, direction, or desired end state for an organisation and its stakeholders
column6: D) It represents a qualitative statement of intent that should be met by the architecture

column2: How many types are there in dependency relationship?
Is the following statement true or false? Architecture descriptions are informal descriptions of an information system.
As per motivational elements, which of the following statement is correct regarding the Constraint?
column3: A) Represents the knowledge or expertise present in, or the interpretation given to, a concept in a particular context
column4: B) Represents the relative worth, utility, or importance of a concept
column5: C) Represents a factor that limits the realisation of goals
column6: D) Represents a statement of need defining a property that applies to a specific system as described by the architecture

column2: Which of the following viewpoint is defined in Appendix C of the ArchiMate Specification?
What is business interface?
column3: A) It is a business entity that is capable of performing behavior
column4: B) It is an aggregate of two or more business internal active structure elements that work together to perform collective behavior
column5: C) It is a point of access where a business service is made available to the environment
column6: D) It is the responsibility for performing specific behavior, to which an actor can be assigned, or the part an actor plays in a particular action or event

column2: Which of the following statement(s) is/are correct regarding the Application Process?
column3: A) It represents a sequence of application behaviors that achieves a specific result
column4: B) It is an application behavior element that denotes a state change
column5: C) It represents data structured for automated processing

column2: What does L stands for in WLAN?

column4: B) is used to communicate between application components
column5: C) A computing device that is part of a piece of equipment
column6: D) An encapsulation of technology infrastructure that is independent of a particular product. A class of technology product

column2: As per defining and classifying viewpoints: purpose dimension, which of the following are examples of the Informing?  I. Animations II. Cartoons III. Cross-reference tables IV. Lists

column3: A) Occurs in a single instance of time
column4: B) Stages work to be completed at some point in time
column5: C) It is a series of actions identified and designed to achieve specific results within specified time and resource constraints
column6: D) Cannot be triggered by an implementation event

column2: As per Technology Layer elements behavior, which of the following statement is correct regarding the Technology Process?
column3: A) It represents a technology state change
column4: B) It represents a sequence of technology behaviors that achieves a specific result
column5: C) It represents an explicitly defined exposed technology behavior
column6: D) It represents a collection of technology behavior that can be performed by a node

column2: What is the primary purpose of the ArchiMate modeling language?
column6: D) To model and visualize enterprise architecture

column2: ArchiMate 3.2 is built upon which previous version of the standard?
How many core layers are there in the ArchiMate language?

What is the purpose of the Motivation extension in ArchiMate?
column3: A) To model business motivations and drivers

column2: Which ArchiMate element represents a tangible, physical component?
What is the relationship between a Business Process and a Business Function in ArchiMate?
column3: A) A Business Process realizes a Business Function
column4: B) A Business Function realizes a Business Process
column5: C) A Business Process aggregates a Business Function
column6: D) A Business Function aggregates a Business Process

column2: What type of element is a "Business Role" in ArchiMate?
Which ArchiMate relationship type indicates that one element uses or leverages the functionality of another element?
What does the "Triggering" relationship in ArchiMate depict?
column3: A) One behavior element initiates the execution of another
column4: B) One element is composed of other elements
column5: C) One element is physically located inside another
column6: D) One element is assigned to another element

column2: What is the purpose of a "Plateau" element in the ArchiMate Implementation & Migration viewpoint?
column3: A) To represent a stable state in the implementation roadmap
column4: B) To model a business capability
column5: C) To model a technical infrastructure component
column6: D) To model a business process

column2: Which ArchiMate concept represents a collection of related elements grouped to address a specific set of concerns?
What is the purpose of the ArchiMate Exchange Format (AEF)?
column3: A) To exchange ArchiMate models between different modeling tools
column4: B) To define the visual notation of ArchiMate diagrams
column5: C) To define the metamodel of the ArchiMate language
column6: D) To provide guidance on how to use ArchiMate in practice

column2: Which of the following is NOT a standard ArchiMate viewpoint?
What is the difference between a Business Service and an Application Service in ArchiMate?
column3: A) A Business Service is offered to internal stakeholders, while an Application Service is offered to external customers
column4: B) A Business Service is realized by an Application Service
column5: C) An Application Service is realized by a Business Service
column6: D) There is no difference; they are interchangeable terms

column2: Which ArchiMate element represents a collection of data that is structured in a specific way?
What is the purpose of the "Composition" relationship in ArchiMate?
column3: A) To show that one element is made up of other elements
column4: B) To indicate that one element is derived from another element
column5: C) To show that one element is dependent on another element
column6: D) To show that one element can access another element

column2: What is the difference between an "Application Component" and an "Application Function" in ArchiMate?
column3: A) An Application Component represents a physical software module, while an Application Function represents a logical unit of functionality
column4: B) An Application Function represents a physical software module, while an Application Component represents a logical unit of functionality
column5: C) An Application Component is used in the Application Layer, while an Application Function is used in the Business Layer
column6: D) An Application Function is used in the Application Layer, while an Application Component is used in the Business Layer

column2: Which ArchiMate relationship type is used to associate a risk with an element that it might impact?
What is the purpose of the "Goal Realization" relationship in ArchiMate?
column3: A) To show how elements contribute to achieving a specific goal
column4: B) To indicate that one element is derived from another element
column5: C) To show that one element is dependent on another element
column6: D) To show that one element can access another element

column2: Which ArchiMate viewpoint focuses on modeling the relationships between business actors and the services they offer or use?
What is the difference between a "Gap" and a "Work Package" in the Implementation & Migration viewpoint?
column3: A) A Gap represents a difference between the baseline and target architectures, while a Work Package represents a unit of work to address a gap
column4: B) A Work Package represents a difference between the baseline and target architectures, while a Gap represents a unit of work to address a work package
column5: C) A Gap is used in the Motivation extension, while a Work Package is used in the Implementation & Migration viewpoint
column6: D) A Work Package is used in the Motivation extension, while a Gap is used in the Implementation & Migration viewpoint

column2: Which ArchiMate element represents a tangible or digital object that is used or produced by a business process?
What is the purpose of the "Flow" relationship in ArchiMate?
column3: A) To show the movement of resources between elements
column4: B) To indicate that one element is derived from another element
column5: C) To show that one element is dependent on another element
column6: D) To show that one element can access another element

column2: Which ArchiMate viewpoint is particularly useful for communicating the value proposition of the architecture to stakeholders?
What is the difference between a "Principle" and a "Requirement" in ArchiMate?
column3: A) A Principle is a high-level guideline, while a Requirement is a more specific and testable statement
column4: B) A Requirement is a high-level guideline, while a Principle is a more specific and testable statement
column5: C) A Principle is used in the Motivation extension, while a Requirement is used in the Implementation & Migration viewpoint
column6: D) A Requirement is used in the Motivation extension, while a Principle is used in the Implementation & Migration viewpoint

column2: Which ArchiMate element represents a collection of nodes and connections that provides a platform for other elements to operate on?
What is the purpose of the "Aggregation" relationship in ArchiMate?
column3: A) To show that one element is a collection or grouping of other elements
column4: B) To indicate that one element is derived from another element
column5: C) To show that one element is dependent on another element
column6: D) To show that one element can access another element

column2: Which ArchiMate viewpoint focuses on modeling the structure and dependencies of the technology infrastructure?
What is the difference between a "Business Interface" and an "Application Interface" in ArchiMate?
column3: A) A Business Interface represents a point of interaction between a business and its external environment, while an Application Interface represents a point of interaction between applications
column4: B) An Application Interface represents a point of interaction between a business and its external environment, while a Business Interface represents a point of interaction between applications
column5: C) A Business Interface is used in the Business Layer, while an Application Interface is used in the Application Layer
column6: D) An Application Interface is used in the Business Layer, while a Business Interface is used in the Application Layer

column2: Which ArchiMate element represents a state or condition of an element?
What is the purpose of the "Specialization" relationship in ArchiMate?
column3: A) To show that one element is a more specific type of another element
column4: B) To indicate that one element is derived from another element
column5: C) To show that one element is dependent on another element
column6: D) To show that one element can access another element

column2: Which ArchiMate element represents a unit of work that needs to be performed in a business process?
What is the purpose of the "Association" relationship in ArchiMate?
column3: A) To show a generic relationship between elements that does not fit into other relationship types
column4: B) To indicate that one element is derived from another element
column5: C) To show that one element is dependent on another element
column6: D) To show that one element can access another element

column2: Which ArchiMate viewpoint focuses on modeling the dynamic behavior of the architecture?
